alert.note: Alert for Alameda; Contra Costa; San Francisco; San Mateo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 29 at 4:31PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: .Rain will continue with moderate to heavy rain band moving in later this evening. Roadway ponding and flooding as well as minor mudslides possible as this main band of rain moves through this evening. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Alameda, Contra Costa, San Francisco and San Mateo. * WHEN...Until 900 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 429 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.1 and 0.7 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.1 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Francisco, Oakland, Fremont, Hayward, Berkeley, Richmond, Daly City, San Mateo, San Leandro, Redwood City, Alameda, Pleasanton, Union City, South San Francisco, Dublin, Newark, San Bruno, Pacifica, Menlo Park and Foster City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Alameda; Contra Costa; San Francisco; San Mateo
